column1: Networking Skills Workshop
column2: Making new contacts is essential to the success of any business and regular networking is one of the best ways to promote your business. At this free, interactive workshop you will learn some simple techniques which will build your confidence and help you get the most out of networking
column4: Reigate Town Hall, Castlefield Road, Reigate, Surrey, RH2 0SH

column1: Paying Your Employees
column2: This workshop is based on the Employer CD-Rom and explains how to calculate tax and National Insurance.  It also covers how to use P45/P46 forms for new employees and leavers, how to register for online services and where to get help when needed.

column1: Becoming an Employer - What You Need to Know
column2: This workshop is based on the Employer CD-Rom and explains how to calculate tax and National Insurance.  It also covers how to use P45/P46 forms for new employees and leavers, how to register for online services and where to get help when needed.

column1: Becoming an Employer - What You Need to Know
column2: This workshop is based on the Employer CD-Rom and explains how to calculate tax and National Insurance.  It also covers how to use P45/P46 forms for new employees and leavers, how to register for online services and where to get help when needed.

column1: Business Operations for Start-Ups
column2:
This workshop provides key information on the operations of a business including the resources required, systems and procedures, production, health and safety and quality.

This workshop also provides guidance on other areas such as the advantages and disadvantages of working from home and environmental issues.

column1: Becoming an Employer - What You Need to Know
column2: This workshop is based on the Employer CD-Rom and explains how to calculate tax and National Insurance.  It also covers how to use P45/P46 forms for new employees and leavers, how to register for online services and where to get help when needed.

column1: Financial Planning for Start-Ups
column2:
This workshop will take you through the process of preparing and analysing financial statements and provides information on how to prepare cash flow forecasts, profit & loss accounts and balance sheets.

The workshop demonstrates how using and understanding these tools can help you to control your business finances.

column1: Financial Planning for Start-Ups
column2:
This workshop will take you through the process of preparing and analysing financial statements and provides information on how to prepare cash flow forecasts, profit & loss accounts and balance sheets.

The workshop demonstrates how using and understanding these tools can help you to control your business finances.

column1: Procurement Trainaing Workshop - London 2012 Olympic & Paralympic Games
column2:
Ensure you are ready to compete for London 2012 and other public sector opportunities. 

There are thousands of opportunities for SMEs to win business from the public sector. There are, however, a number of procedures and processes that you must understand to ensure that you maximise these opportunities.
column4: Royal National College for the Blind, College Road, Hereford.

column1: Introductory - Accessing Public Sector Tenders
column2: This interactive workshop on tender writing is run by CEis and partners. It's aimed at managers and staff, providing introductory, intermediate and advanced levels. With contributions from experts in successful tender writing, the worskhops will offer practical guidance for organisations wishing to compete for public sector contracts.

column1: Becoming an Employer - What You Need to Know
column2: This workshop is based on the Employer CD-Rom and explains how to calculate tax and National Insurance.  It also covers how to use P45/P46 forms for new employees and leavers, how to register for online services and where to get help when needed.

column1: Becoming an Employer - What You Need to Know
column2: This workshop is based on the Employer CD-Rom and explains how to calculate tax and National Insurance.  It also covers how to use P45/P46 forms for new employees and leavers, how to register for online services and where to get help when needed.

column1: Inward Processing Relief
column2: This course will cover Inward Processing Relief (IPR) and discuss the procedures, terminology and common errors involved. It will explain where reduced or nil duty and VAT costs may be available to those who are importing into the EU for re-exportation back outside the EU.

column1: Becoming an Employer - What You Need to Know
column2: This workshop is based on the Employer CD-Rom and explains how to calculate tax and National Insurance.  It also covers how to use P45/P46 forms for new employees and leavers, how to register for online services and where to get help when needed.

column1: Health and Safety Legislation - Half Day
column2: Anyone who has some control over premises must take reasonable steps to reduce the risk from fire and make sure people can safely escape if there is a fire.  Speakers from the Fire Service will explain the requirements of Fire safety legislation and give practical information on how to help comply with this
column4: The Methodist Church, Coventry Central Hall

column1: Paying Someone for the First Time Using the Employer CD-Rom
column2: This event will explain how to install the CD-ROM, use it to work out an employee's tax and National Insurance deductions, what details you need to include on a wage slip, fill in forms when an employee starts or leaves your employment and work out your payments due to HMRC.

column1: Paying Someone for the First Time Using the Employer CD-Rom
column2: This event will explain how to install the CD-ROM, use it to work out an employee's tax and National Insurance deductions, what details you need to include on a wage slip, fill in forms when an employee starts or leaves your employment and work out your payments due to HMRC.

column1: Business over Breakfast
column2:
Come and network over breakfast with companies from around North Wales. 
During networking you will have the opportunity to speak to Academics and staff from the university to discuss the commercial expertise available at Glyndŵr University to help develop your business. To reserve your free place please contact Sam Clutton on 01978 293 183
column4: Deeside Enterprise Centre, Rowleys Drive, Shotton, Queensferry

column1: Prince 2 - Foundation and Practioner
column2: This internationally respected course is based on the new Managing Successful Projects with PRINCE2 2009.  The updated course will help those running projects of any size in any environment to effectively deliver what is required appropriately managing the costs, timescales, quality, scope, risks and benefits. To book a place on this event please contact Rebecca Arrowsmith on 02920 416414

column1: Introbiz Networking Event
column2: At introbiz, they pride themselves on finding out before the meeting the types of businesses you d like to connect with, so that it will be more beneficial to you, making it more time and cost effective, as time is money. introbiz introduces new contacts that will develop into new businesses. To book a place on thuis event please email info@introbiz.co.uk

column1: Salisbury Breakfast Club - 5 Oct
column2:
Salisbury Breakfast Club provides you with a good opportunity for informal, relaxed and non-pressure networking. With informal information slots at each breakfast, the emphasis is on enjoyment and informality to keep a bright modern approach to the meetings. You'll have the opportunity to network with fellow delegates before breakfast and throughout the morning. This event is run by Bonallack & Bishop Solicitors and is sponsored by Business Link.

Date: 5 Oct 2010
Location: Grasmere House Hotel, Salisbury SP2 8JN
Organiser: Business Link with Bonallack & Bishop
Event Type: Breakfasts / Lunches / Dinners, Information Sessions, Networking
Cost: £10 per person
Business Sector: All industries

column1: Advanced Finance for Managers
column2: This residential advanced finance workshop is run by CEiS and partners. It’s aimed at managers of Third Sector Organisations. The aim of the training is to improve the capacity of Third Sector organisations to control finances and engage in high-quality financial planning. The workshop offers a mixture of class-based activity, participative learning exercises and peer learning. You can contribute and share ideas and experiences.
